channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024010434
item.description:
Report X-2024010434

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO PICK UP LEAKER ON THE IRREG BELT. SMALL AMOUNT OF FLUID WAS ON THE BELT. USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO DON ON PROPER PPE FOR THE SPILL, RESPONDER PUT THE BUCKET ON A SPILL TRAY AND LID HAD A CRACK ON TOP. RESPONDER CONTINUED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL WITH ABSORBENT PADS AND MOVED PACKAGE TO THE PSC AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023120561
item.description:
Report X-2023120561

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TCIX 160065 identified with release from manway area. Manway gasket inspected and found to be pinched and misaligned. Manway gasket was secured and exterior of tank car decontaminated for continued movement.

  • Description: The KAG Energy driver overfilled the trailer during the loading process. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Graymar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024010242
item.description:
Report X-2024010242

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010242 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND DURING UNLOADING. QA PLACED PACKAGE IN RED HAZMAT TOTE & TAKEN AWAY TO BE PROCESSED. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PROMPTLY PLACED IN TOTE & TAKEN AWAY FROM UNLOAD AREA. 2. X-2024010245 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND DURING UNLOADING. QA PLACED PACKAGE IN RED HAZMAT TOTE & TAKEN AWAY TO BE PROCESSED. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PROMPTLY PLACED IN TOTE & TAKEN AWAY FROM THE UNLOAD AREA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was tipped on it's side and leaked. DescribePack: Lid was not on the container properly which caused it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was stood upright and placed inside the Hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024010253
item.description:
Report X-2024010253

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process unload crew noticed the leaking package. Package was place in a hazardous bag and tote and staged for proper inspection. Three packages were damaged from the hazmat. DescribePack: Cap failure. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Packages were placed in hazardous bags and totes.

item.title: Report E-2024010219
item.description:
Report E-2024010219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 16-ounce spill of regulated UN1824 "Instant PowerÂ® Hair Clog Remover" that was released at Terminal UPH. (1) a 33-ounce plastic bottle was punctured during loading operations impacting Trailer #463-4139 and underneath the trailer. The terminal decided they would clean up the release with terminal-used PPE onsite. (1) 30-plastic drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material used, plastic bottle, and the issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
